meanings.definition: having the power, skill, means, or opportunity to do something
meanings.sent1: She is the ablest student in the class, always completing her assignments on time.
meanings.sent2: He is the ablest mechanic in town, able to fix any car problem.
meanings.sent3: The ablest chef in the restaurant accidentally added salt instead of sugar to the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was the ablest tool in her arsenal, solving complex problems effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The ablest swimmer in the competition glided through the water like a graceful dolphin.

meanings.definition: having considerable skill, proficiency, or intelligence
meanings.sent1: The ablest artist in the group painted a beautiful landscape that impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: He is the ablest chess player I know, always winning against tough opponents.
meanings.sent3: The ablest comedian in the show had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her ablest trait was her quick wit, always coming up with clever responses.
meanings.sent5: The ablest musician in the orchestra played the violin with incredible precision.

meanings.definition: having the necessary physical or mental capacity to perform a task
meanings.sent1: The ablest athlete in the team scored the winning goal in the final match.
meanings.sent2: She is the ablest student in math, always acing her exams.
meanings.sent3: The ablest actor in the play forgot his lines during the most crucial scene.
meanings.sent4: His ablest moment came when he lifted the heavy boulder effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The ablest surgeon in the hospital performed the delicate surgery with precision.
